title: Mention the `master` branch as the target of pull requests in contrib…

…uting.md.

Also, improve grammar a bit in the same guide.

title: Check cancelation in KotlinJavaPsiFacade.findPackage()
body:
This may help with some UI freezes caused by KT-33394, although
it does not fix the underlying performance problem.

title: JVM IR: Use correct naming scheme for SAM wrappers
body:
There's two parts to this PR:
- SAM conversion applied to callable references or lambdas does not generate a wrapper, but instead generates a callable reference class.
- SAM wrappers are cached based on the file class (if present) or the enclosing top-level class and in particular are always local to a top-level class.
- This means that it's actually easier to generate correct class names for SAM wrappers in the corresponding lowering than in `InventNamesForLocalClasses`.

There's one more corner case, involving SAM wrappers used in the scope of an inline function, which is not handled by this PR (mostly because it depends on #2523).

Finally, I've added a couple of additional tests, which check that a bound receiver in a callable reference is only evaluated once.

Additionally the code now handles SAM conversion of references to functions with default arguments or varargs. This is currently rejected by the frontend, because of the way type inference for SAM arguments works, but it ends up reducing code duplication here.

title: Incremental KAPT: when unable to process incremental changes, run non-incrementally
body:
Incremental KAPT: when unable to process incremental changes, run non-incrementally

When analyzing incremental changes in the KAPT task, incremental compilation
can handle directory changes, Java source file changes, jar/.class file changes,
and changes to the ABI structure of the classpath. Anything else should cause
a full recompilation.

Test: KaptIncrementalWithIsolatingApt.testNonIncrementalWithUnrecognizedInputs

title: Improve reliability of simulator test runner
body: With a recent Xcode (10.3) or macOS (10.14.6) upgrade, I've been consistently running into issues getting the test runner to work (example: https://dev.azure.com/autodeskoss/coroutineworker/_build/results?buildId=24&view=logs). Switching to standalone mode, which I believe has something to do with hinting to simctl that it doesn't need to fully boot a simulator (i.e. just execute the binary), makes multiplatform/native tests run more reliably in these scenarios.

title: Update Kotlin Native version for 1.3.50 EAP 3
JVM IR: Handle special case visibility rules for callable references
body:
A class for a callable reference is package private by default and public when it is used inside of an inline function.

Since we are moving functions around during compilation, we have to record this information early in the compilation pipeline. Fortunately, `InventNamesForLocalClasses` already provides infrastructure to record information about local classes and we can reuse this to mark classes which were defined in the body of an inline function.

Annotate object INSTANCE field as @NotNull in bytecode

I believe a change needs to be made to the light classes, but I'm not sure where that needs to take place. Perhaps `ByJvmSignatureIndexer`? But it's not clear to me how to denote annotations there.

body: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22412

title: JVM IR: Fix field visibility and ACC_DEPRECATED flags
body:
This PR adds a lowering to set field visibility and adds more handling for `@Deprecated` annotations. 

Currently, psi2ir produces fields with the same visibility as the underlying property, which is usually correct except for a few special cases. I've implemented this as a separate lowering, since it's potentially useful to set the visibility in other lowerings, instead of relying on special cases in `ClassCodegen`. For example, `AssertionLowering` should produce package private fields.

Going forward, it might be a good idea to add this into psi2ir directly, but it's not clear that this is the desired behavior for the other backends.

For the second part, there's already some handling for `ACC_DEPRECATED` in `FunctionCodegen`, this PR just fills in more cases.

The two commits depend on each other to fix some tests (e.g., `testTopLevelProperty`), otherwise I would have split this into two PRs.

title: JVM IR: Convert interface companion fields to static fields.
body: `MoveCompanionObjectFieldsLowering` replaces fields in a companion object with static fields in the enclosing class. Currently the lowering ignores fields in interface companions (unless they are marked with `@JvmField`). This PR adds support for fields in interface companions, which we do not want to move, but still have to mark as static.

title: Run KAPT non-incrementally if annotation processor classpath changes
body:
Annotation processor classpath for a KAPT run is recorded, and the current
run is compared against the previous one. If those differ, KAPT should
run non-incrementally.

Test: KaptIncrementalWithIsolatingApt.testChangingAnnotationProcessorClasspath

title: Delete output when unable to run KAPT incrementally
body:
When comparing previous and current classpath snapshots, and it is not
possible to compute the types that changed, make sure to delete the outputs
before invoking KAPT.

Test: KaptIncrementalWithAggregatingApt.testIncompatibleClasspathChanges

title: KT-14946 Move statement up/down (with Ctrl+Shift+Up/Down) messes with empty lines
body: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-14946

title: JVM IR: Remove bridge construction from CallableReferenceLowering
body:
Currently, there is some code duplication between `CallableReferenceLowering`, `BridgeLowering`, and `FunctionNVarargInvokeLowering`. Specifically, `CallableReferenceLowering` builds a bridge method to `invoke`, which is either an ordinary bridge as generated in `BridgeLowering`, or a specialized vararg bridge as in `FunctionNVarargInvokeLowering`.

Furthermore, `FunctionNVarargInvokeLowering` implements some JVM IR specific behavior for functions with a large number of arguments, which is incompatible with the changes outlined in [KT-32698](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-32698) as explained in [KT-32701](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-32701). It also generates custom error messages, resulting in a lot of bytecode which is probably unnecessary.

This PR generalizes `FunctionNVarargInvokeLowering` (renamed to `FunctionNVarargBridgeLowering`) to handle the cases produced by `CallableReferenceLowering` and removes all bridge generation from `CallableReferenceLowering`.

This almost works perfectly, except that `BridgeLowering` currently doesn't remove the `overriddenSymbols` from the bridged method, resulting in unnecessary boxed return types. I've fixed this as much as it was relevant for `CallableReferenceLowering`, but the issue probably still persists in other cases.

title: JVM IR: Add a lowering to replace varargs with arrays
body:
Currently the JVM IR backend handles varargs directly in `ExpressionCodegen`. This PR instead adds a lowering to replace all vararg calls with explicit array arguments and removes the special handling from the rest of the compiler. As a side benefit, I've added a utility for building arrays in the IR (which is JVM specific right now, because of the way we handle arrays with spreads).

This fixes some corner cases, such as the `arrayOf` function not generating reified operation markers. Incidentally, this bug caused `testKt8047` to pass before, but this was a fluke. There is an anonymous object in this test which was not specialized. I've made this more clear in `testKt8047_2`, which uses a reified type check instead of `arrayOf`.

The only difference in the generated code should be that arrays are copied using `System.arraycopy`, instead of `Arrays.copyOf`, because this was easier in the IR.

title: Add Pair to Triple extention method
body:
This extension method allows for easy creation of Triples, i.e:
```kotlin
1 to 2 to 3 //Triple(1,2,3)
```

title: Use receiver syntax for lambda execution
body:
That way, it's easier to see that we refer to the property just above and execute the passed lambda.

Closes #2506

title: Fix handling of inline classes in DefaultParameterInjector
body:
There are some cases where `DefaultParameterInjector` adds unnecessary boxing for inline class arguments, since `IrClass.underlyingType` doesn't recursively unfold inline classes. Since the rules for unfolding inline classes differ by backend I've fixed this by adding a new function in the `Ir` class and removing the `IrClass.underlyingType` function.

I've added a test for this, as well as for another issue where default vararg arguments allocate an unnecessary array. I've got a different fix in the works for the latter, but we might as well add the test now.

title: Use clearer syntax for lambda execution
body: That way, it's easier to see that we refer to the property just above and execute the passed lambda.

title: Improve error message
body:
Fore the case where a target has been created or configured twice with different presets,
avoid showing "null" inside the error message if existing target has not preset,
and append a point.
